Project Description:This scope outlines minor interior improvements to the existing commercial structure. The intent is to maintain the building’s current layout and function while addressing cosmetic updates and finish repairs. No structural, mechanical, electrical, or plumbing work is required or proposed as part of this submission.Interior Work Summary:1. Drywall RepairPatch and repair existing drywall holes and minor damage throughout the first and second floors.Light sanding and prep to create a smooth, paint-ready surface.No new framing, reconfiguration, or demolition is proposed.2. PaintingApply primer and two coats of commercial-grade paint to all interior walls.Ceilings will remain exposed and will not be painted.Paint colors to match or complement existing finishes with a neutral palette.3. FlooringFirst Floor: Install commercial-grade epoxy flooring over the existing concrete. Surface to be prepped by cleaning and light leveling; vapor barrier to be applied if required.Second Floor: Install commercial-grade carpet (glue-down installation) over existing subfloor in all finished areas.4. CeilingThe existing ceiling structure, including beams and systems, will remain exposed. Mechanical / Electrical / Plumbing (M.E.P.):Mechanical: No changes or updates to HVAC systems.Electrical: No new or modified electrical work.Plumbing: No plumbing work or fixture changes included.Demolition:No demolition is planned or proposed.The existing structure and layout remain unchanged.Exterior Work:No exterior alterations, improvements, or site work included.

The existing one-story, slab-on-grade building will be accompanied by a rooftop bar and dining area. The rooftop will include an enclosed bar area. Electrical Demolition 1. Remove all existing electrical systems, including devices, conduits, wiring, and components, within the 6,854 sq. ft. demolition area. 2. Cap and secure all decommissioned circuits and devices as necessary for safety. 3. Ensure all demolition debris is removed and coordinated with other trades as per project requirements. Temporary Power and Lighting 1. Furnish and install temporary electrical power and lighting as required to facilitate construction activities. 2. Maintain temporary systems in safe working conditions throughout the construction phase. Electrical Distribution and Gear 1. Furnish and install a new 240/120V 400A main distribution panel (MDP) with all associated grounding and connections. 2. Install a 240V/2P 400A service disconnect as per project plans. 3. Furnish and install the complete electrical gear package, including panels, disconnects, and transformers as per the riser diagram. 4. Perform all required grounding per NEC standards. Lighting Installation 1. Install lighting fixtures as specified in the plans, including the following: • Ceiling and wall-mounted fixtures: Types A (45), B (9), C (4), D (6), E (3), F (3), G (3), H (1), I (5), J (1), and K (4). • Exit signs (10) and emergency lighting fixtures (14). 2.  Install all lighting controls, including: • Standard switches (6), 3-way switches (6), and 4-way switches (2). • Vacancy sensors: wall-mounted (17), ceiling-mounted (7), and power pack sensors (6). 3. Coordinate lighting layouts and fixture placement with the Architect and Interior Designer. Power Systems 1. Install all branch circuits and receptacles, including: • Wall-mounted duplex outlets (37). • Floor-mounted flush duplex outlets (3) with saw-cutting included. • GFCI outlets (5) and GFCI outlets on dedicated circuits (4). 2. Provide power connections to the following equipment: • Exhaust fans (4), dishwasher (1), circulation pumps (2), and elevator (1;240V/2P/90A). 3. Install wiring and conduits for a total of 280 circuits as per project requirements. 4. All conductors to be installed utilizing MC cable where allowable by code. Low Voltage and Communication 1. Install raceways and conduits for telephone and data systems, covering 3,000 feet as specified. 2. Provide rough-in boxes for TV installations (5 rough-ins total). Fire Caulking, Testing and Compliance 1. Perform fire caulking for all penetrations through rated walls and floors to meet applicable building codes. 2. Ensure all work complies with NEC, NFPA, and local building codes. 3. Conduct all required testing and inspections, including: • Circuit testing, grounding verification, and operational testing of installed equipment. • Testing and balancing of electrical loads to ensure compliance. 4. Submit final as-built drawings and updated panel schedules to the Owner. Coordination 1. Coordinate with other trades to ensure smooth integration of electrical systems with structural, mechanical, and architectural elements. 2. Attend all required site meetings and inspections. 3. Resolve spatial conflicts and adjust routing of conduits or wiring as needed. Deliverables 1. Provide as-built documents showing any deviations from the contract drawings. 2. Deliver updated panel schedules with accurate circuit descriptions for all affected panels. 3. Submit product documentation and warranty information for all installed equipment.

address: 3711 MARTIN L KING JR DR SW, ATLANTA GA 00000
description: a) Adding a new 30 MGD pump to an existing pump station.b) Providing dedicated suction and discharge pipes for Pump No. 4, including control valve and associated appurtenances; c) Building a structure adjacent to the existing pump station to house Pump No. 4; d) Provide an HVAC system for the Pump Room, VFD Room, and Electrical Room inside the new structure;  e)  New electrical system (switchgear, backup power generator, and wiring) to support the operation of Pump No. 4; f) Replacing poor-condition discharge pipes at Pump Nos. 1, 2, and 3 between the pump flange and the discharge header; g) Replacing the original, inefficient, difficult-to-maintain synchronous motor with induction-type motor for pump #3.  Motor pedestal shall be modified as required to align pump and motor shafts; h) Installing a new motor and VFD on Pump No. 3 to improve operational flexibility at a broader range of hydraulic operating conditions.  Motor pedestal shall be adjusted to maintain alignment with the pump shaft; i) Replacing the existing switchgear, which has reached the end of its useful life and is deemed a critical failure risk; j) Replacing original, poor-condition electrical wiring between the existing pump 3 starters and the pump motor; k) Provide ventilation of the existing pump room to mitigate the corrosive environment affecting pumps, pipes, and valves; l) Upgrade the Allen-Bradley ControlLogix PLC to the latest versions, including Racks, CPUs, I/O Modules, Communication Cards, and auxiliary appurtenances.  m) Replace the existing ControlNet communication network with Ethernet IP.   n) Replace the existing Allen-Bradley PanelView operator interface in kind with the latest version; o) For the three existing pumps, replace the existing original hydraulic accumulator system which operates the discharge ball valves, with a new system.  The new system shall include a simpler, low maintenance design, matching the original operating characteristics, and have the ability to return the pump discharge valves to the closed position in the event of a power failure.  Key functional parameters shall be tied-in to the SCADA system for external monitoring,  This requires an addition to the existing building with a power generator.

BA keypad will be installed in lobby near main entry. Hold up buttons do not get mounted they will be programmed and tested and given to POC.***Access Control SystemJohnson Controls (JCI) is to install a new access control and intercom system as detailed below. JCI will ensure all components are installed per the customer’s standard and requirements, including power supply and integration for proper functionality. The system will be deployed at the customer’s new location located at 999 Peachtree St NE Suite 1100, Atlanta, GA 30309.System Description and Installation Details:Master Station Installation:JCI will install a JP-4MED Master Station with a 7-inch touchscreen at the designated front desk location. The master station will be powered using a 120 VAC outlet, as specified in the design documents, ensuring its compatibility with the provided infrastructure.Substations and Video Door Stations:Two (2) JP-4HD substation video units will be wall-mounted indoors at a height of 48 inches AFF (above finished floor).One (1) JP-DA exterior surface-mount video door station will be installed at the main entrance for visitor communication and monitoring.Access Control Keypads:Two (2) UL-listed IEI keypads (Linear 200E – 2000 Series) will be installed outside the front and rear doors. These standalone keypads will integrate with the customer-provided locking hardware for secure access control.The keypads will not be connected to an access control head-end system but will function independently to manage door release and entry access.Network Infrastructure:JCI will deploy an Aiphone Network Series system, including a PoE+ switch and all new CAT6 cabling for connectivity between devices. A RY-8Z distribution adaptor and RY-1824L relay units will be included to facilitate the networked operation of the intercom and door release system.Power Supply and Lock Integration:JCI will ensure the installation of PS-2420UL power supplies to support the intercom systems. Lock power supplies and locking hardware will be configured & provided By Others.Additional Equipment:MCW-S/B desk stands will be provided for select devices where necessary.SM8TAT2SA-NA switches will be installed to enable optimal network connectivity and redundancy.

The system will be deployed at the customer’s new location located at 999 Peachtree St NE Suite 1100, Atlanta, GA 30309.System Description and Installation Details:Master Station Installation:JCI will install a JP-4MED Master Station with a 7-inch touchscreen at the designated front desk location. These standalone keypads will integrate with the customer-provided locking hardware for secure access control.The keypads will not be connected to an access control head-end system but will function independently to manage door release and entry access.Network Infrastructure:JCI will deploy an Aiphone Network Series system, including a PoE+ switch and all new CAT6 cabling for connectivity between devices. A RY-8Z distribution adaptor and RY-1824L relay units will be included to facilitate the networked operation of the intercom and door release system.Power Supply and Lock Integration:JCI will ensure the installation of PS-2420UL power supplies to support the intercom systems. Disconnect 4 parallel sets of 1000 kcmil from the transition box and install to the top of the 1200A disconnect and run 4 parallel sets of 400 kcmil from the load side of the 1200A disconnect to the copper buss in the transition box to feed the new 2000A MDP -1.  We will need the power disconnected from the transformer in different weekends.  First weekend will install 1200A disconnect and temporary run power from the load side of the disconnect to power up existing MDP-2, circuits from MDP-1 will temporarily be relocated to MDP-2 which will feed the building temporary while during the week the old MDP-1 will be removed and the new MDP-1 be installed.  The second shut down of the transformer will permanently connect the load side of the 1200A disconnect to the new MDP-1 and circuits will be transferred back to the new MDP-1“This permit authorizes work only for the approved trade. This project is an electrical service upgrade at 4811 Virginia Dare Ln. The existing main service equipment has sustained heat damage with portions of the disconnect showing signs of burning. While the service entrance conductors from the utility to the meter are intact and will remain in place the equipment from the meter socket to the main panel requires replacement and upgrade to ensure safety and compliance with Austin Energy standards.
The work includes replacing the existing main disconnect with a 150A rated device and installing a new 200A approved meter socket to replace the older existing meter enclosure. The meter base upgrade ensures compliance with Austin Energy¿s current list of approved meter sockets. The existing service conductors between the meter and main panel will be re-terminated and inspected for condition and proper connections. No changes will be made to the utility-side service entrance conductors.
All work will include proper grounding and bonding per NEC and Austin Energy requirements. The installation will be performed with coordination for same-day disconnect/reconnect with Austin Energy to minimize service downtime for the homeowner. Final inspection will be scheduled through the AB+C portal and the completed installation will provide a safe code-compliant service upgrade to replace older damaged equipment while maintaining the approved service configuration per the ESPA.  service is underground
